0.Summary: "Be prepared to work all the time"
0.Pros: Mostly new staff, open to (some) new ideas; new HQ in West Loop; travel opportunities; half day Fridays in the Summer
0.Cons: No work/life balance, you will consistently work nights/12 hour days; benefits are ok - not as stellar as you would think a high-profile corporation would be; communication between departments is not great.

1.Pros: it was an easy job flexible schedule

2.Pros: Employees are fun, very fast working pace.
2.Cons: Head managers are inconsiderate. If you need scheduled accordingly they get mad. If you call off you get wrote up. Even if its for a death.

3.Pros: You get to be good friends with some of your coworkers. Flexibility.
3.Cons: Managers pick favorites and cause problems with the crew.

4.Pros: Opportunities for advancement, free meals, discounted food, flexible schedule
4.Cons: The pay was low when I worked there, but they pay above minimum wage now

5.Pros: benefits are full, and people first
5.Cons: it is kind board and tired

7.Pros: Flexible hours, easy to switch shifts
7.Cons: Boring, repetitive tasks; pressure to work quickly

8.Pros: Lots of free food which was nice.
8.Cons: Pay wasn't that good but whatever.

9.Pros: Great hours, flexible schedule, fun first job, food is great (in my opinion)
9.Cons: There are not any cons, especially when I worked here
